SOCIAL MEDIA

Florence, Italy

October 29, 2019

Florence was the second of four stops on my week-long fall break. This series is a bit longer as it was one of my favorite cities that I visited while abroad. The city was beautiful; my hostel was one street away from Piazzala del Duomo; the food was amazing—–I had a wonderful steak dinner paired with a house wine for 20 euros.

  • Shot from Piazzale Michelangelo, taken 30 minutes after I first arrived in Florence.
  • Ponte Vecchio: first shot I take on my way to Michelangelo's Square.
  • Sitting atop Michelangelo's Square like the tourist I am.
  • Man strumming guitar on stairwell to Michelangelo's Square.
  • Long exposure of city, taken atop Giotto's Bell Tower.
  • Looking over city from Brunelleschi's dome.
  • Sunset framed through star in Brunelleschi's dome.
  • Pigeon leading carriage horse through Piazzala del Duomo.
  • Pigeons perching in 3-2-1 formation.
  • Mosaic ceiling: Baptistery of St. John.
  • Obicà Mozzarella Bar wine bottle aesthetic.
  • Friend I met during my Florence trip lifting weights in Leonardo da Vinci Museum.
  • Mirror, mirror, more mirrors.
  • Gelato shop, one of many Italy is famous for.
  • Vibrant selection of wine inside Florence's famous Sant'Ambrogio Market.
  • Two friends, also abroad, returning home after impromptu dinner.
  • Boolin' around Boboli Garden part 1.
  • Confused about where to go next.
  • Rain droplets resting on fall leaves.
  • Boolin' around Boboli Garden part 2.
  • Happy.
